instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message:
Gets to the Apple logo, but no backlight.

The gate of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> is not being pulled low. Enable is present and resistors in the voltage divider are fine. I've replaced <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, still doesn't work. Any suggestions?

I've bridged <CHIP>U8050</CHIP> because I don't have replacement parts. 

Any suggestions?


Thanks, Rick

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message: Tried a known good LCD of the correct year?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message: Yes. Interchangable with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> screen right? Just replaced the LVDS connector, no improvement.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message:
Yeah 3536 is 2013 model too.

Diode mode on pin 3 and 4 of LCD connector?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No backlight
threads.message: Nm. Fixed it by replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>. Thanks for your help!
